intro: Kerrdora laotica, commonly known as the Laos orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture from the forest floor, and it thrives in nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Kerrdora laotica is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
